discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
Standard Email to Case can not be more than 2500/day

B D is correct
- Web-to-Cases does not support attachments, so it's not a valid option:
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.customizesupport_web_to_case_notes.htm&type=5

- Standard Email-to-Case is not the right answer. As This feature controls the number of Cases that can be created within an organization using Email-to-Case. The default limit of this feature is 2500. This cannot be increased.

- The "On-Demand Email-to-Case" feature is calculated by:
1000 * Salesforce license count up to a daily maximum of 1,000,000
Hence, On-Demand Email-to-Case is the correct answer.
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=000389058&type=1
Also, the attachment of documents is restricted under 25 MB in On Demand Email-to-Case.
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.customizesupport_email.htm&type=5

comments.content: I cannot be C due to fact that Email-to-Case is not allowing attachments

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
I think it should be C,D

And the question also states attachments under 25MB which is what Email-on-demand is for. It's B and D. https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.apexcode.meta/apexcode/apex_classes_email_inbound_what_is.htm

Selected Answer: BD
Standard email to case only has a max of 2500 https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=000389058&type=1
Web to case doesn't allow attachments without workarounds https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=000386429&type=1

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers wants to reduce the amount of time support agents spend creating cases. Case creation must scale up to 5000 new cases per day, as well as allowing file attachments under 25 MB by the customer.

Which two features should the consultant suggest? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Why D is wrong answer?

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers (UC) added a channel to the Service Cloud deployment. UC wants the functionality to include the ability to log the case thread and store attachments to the case record.

Which channel should a consultant recommend to meet these requirements?

Universal Containers is preparing to implement Service Cloud for its global Support team. Requirements gathering sessions have resulted in a large set of required deliverables.

What should a consultant recommend as the next step?

choices.A: Prioritize the requirements based on who submitted them.
choices.B: Identify the requirements needed for initial GoLive.
choices.C: Provide a timeline that addresses all the requirements.
choices.D: Organize the requirements from the largest to smallest.

discussion.content: Identifying the requirements needed for initial GoLive is the recommended next step after gathering a large set of required deliverables for implementing Service Cloud. Identifying the requirements needed for initial GoLive involves prioritizing the requirements based on their importance, urgency, complexity, and dependency. This can help determine the scope and timeline of the project, as well as the resources and budget needed. Identifying the requirements needed for initial GoLive can also help avoid scope creep, manage expectations, and ensure a successful implementation.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers has implemented a call-based response system. The call wait time has become too long and customer service is being affected. Management would like to find a way for their agents to handle more customer transaction per day.

Which two features should a Consultant recommend? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
A and C

choices.B: Standard Email-to Case with assignment rules
choices.C: Lightning Email with web routing prioritization

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Both email2case and web2case could be used, the point is related to 'structured' word. Web-2-case is much more structured to Email2Case because you can select wich fields will be avaiable in the web-form, so you are structuring the data to be routed by assignment rules
The keyword here is "log" you can only do that from a website like a Lightning Experience Community. Answer is A
B to me, email-to-case support logs.

comments.content: Only web to case can give structured data

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers wants customers to have the ability to log cases with structured data and route based on urgency and product line.

How should a consultant accomplish this?
